definition: to snatch gold/to take first place in a competition
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: So what about sports? What kind of sports do Thai delegation expect gold from?
sentences.chinese: 那麼運動方面，哪些運動是泰國隊希望奪金的呢？

sentences.english: It was the first gold won by a swimmer in a Speedo suit in Rome.
sentences.chinese: 這是身着Speedo泳衣的運動員首次在羅馬奪金。

sentences.english: Chinese men's gymnastics is one of the key gold-seizing events.
sentences.chinese: 中國男子競技體操是我國奧運戰略的重點奪金項目。

definition: Lee Lai-Shan (1970-), former windsurfing world champion from Hong Kong
Ever Victorious Army (1860-1864), Qing dynasty army equipped and trained jointly with Europeans and used esp. against the Taiping rebels
National Games, Chinese athletics competition, organized every four years since 1959
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
Taichung or Taizhong county in central Taiwan
Grammy Award (US prize for music recording)/also written 格萊美獎|格莱美奖
